answers.answer: The rest didn't post... Basically I HATE HEARING THE DOC SAY NOTHING CAn BE DONE JUST MONITOR!! I believe all things are possible with God! I have increased my water intake to about a gallon a day, taking liquid fish oils, powder magnesium, all to help support my liver and kidney functions... I need to know if there is anything else I can do!! My little girl needs to stay in the oven for at least another 6 weeks!! God willing the whole 16!!! PLEASE HELP ME

With my  first I was diagnosed at 20 week's carried till 37 weeks 5 days she came on her own.I didn't take anything to help my preeclampsia. I just walked more and less salt intake. I didn't do bed rest like they told me too I stayed more active.and drank more water as well. So far I am 33 weeks and I am hoping i don't get it this time.

My Dr told me I was near preeclamptic my last pregnancy at 39+2 weeks. They induced me because I wasn't dilated, I had super horrible swelling for weeks leading to that point, protein in my urine and high blood pressure at my 39+2 week check up had me sent to er. My blood pressure kept up all night into the next morning, but they never officially diagnosed it as preeclampsia. Hoping I don't get it with this one  I'm 22 weeks now but haven't had any swelling and blood pressure has been pretty good.

I just had my 2nd son on Saturday, with both I had preeclamplsia,  first time from 28wks and this time from 15wks. It was really tough and I kept going into preterm labour but my dr managed to get me to 36wks using aspirin, calcium and bp meds. Hang in there, it can be done!

question: I'm pregnant with my second baby. With my first I developed preeclampsia at 36 weeks. I'm 24 weeks now and have been officially diagnosed with preeclampsia since 20 weeks. I'm glad I've made it this far with no major complications... I've done 2 24 hour urine collections
title: preeclampsia too soon
